name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework
description: The NIST Cybersecurity Framework provides a policy framework of computer security guidance for how private sector organizations can assess and improve their ability to prevent, detect, and respond to cyber attacks.

controls.title: Physical Device Inventory
controls.description: Physical devices and systems within the organization are inventoried. Maintaining an accurate inventory of all hardware assets ensures visibility and supports risk management.

controls.title: Software Platform Inventory
controls.description: Software platforms and applications within the organization are inventoried. Tracking all software assets supports vulnerability management and license compliance.

controls.title: Resource Prioritization
controls.description: Resources such as hardware, devices, data, and software are prioritized based on their classification, criticality, and business value.

controls.title: Organizational Mission Priorities
controls.description: Priorities for organizational mission, objectives, and activities are established and communicated. These priorities inform cybersecurity roles, responsibilities, and risk management decisions.

controls.title: Information Security Policy
controls.description: Organizational cybersecurity policy is established and communicated. The policy sets the strategic direction for the organization's cybersecurity program.

controls.title: Vulnerability Identification
controls.description: Asset vulnerabilities are identified and documented. Systematic vulnerability identification enables timely remediation and risk reduction.

controls.title: Threat Identification
controls.description: Threats, both internal and external, are identified and documented. Understanding threats enables the organization to prepare appropriate defenses.

controls.title: Risk Management Process
controls.description: Risk management processes are established, managed, and agreed to by organizational stakeholders. A formal risk management process ensures consistent identification, assessment, and treatment of risks.

controls.title: Identity and Credential Management
controls.description: Identities and credentials are issued, managed, verified, revoked, and audited for authorized devices, users, and processes. Strong identity management is foundational to access control.

controls.title: Remote Access Management
controls.description: Remote access is managed through controlled and monitored connections. Securing remote access reduces the attack surface from external connections.

controls.title: Least Privilege Access
controls.description: Access permissions and authorizations are managed using the principle of least privilege and separation of duties. This limits the potential impact of compromised accounts.

controls.title: Security Awareness Training
controls.description: All users are informed and trained on their cybersecurity responsibilities. Regular awareness training reduces the risk of human error and social engineering attacks.

controls.title: Data-at-Rest Protection
controls.description: Data-at-rest is protected through encryption and other safeguards. Protecting stored data prevents unauthorized access in the event of physical or logical compromise.

controls.title: Data-in-Transit Protection
controls.description: Data-in-transit is protected through encryption and other safeguards. Encrypting data during transmission prevents interception and tampering.

controls.title: Data Leakage Prevention
controls.description: Protections against data leaks are implemented. Data loss prevention controls help ensure sensitive information does not leave the organization's control.

controls.title: Configuration Baselines
controls.description: A baseline configuration of IT systems is created and maintained incorporating security principles. Configuration baselines reduce the attack surface and ensure consistent security posture.

controls.title: Maintenance Management
controls.description: Maintenance and repair of organizational assets are performed and logged in a timely manner using approved and controlled tools. Proper maintenance reduces vulnerabilities from unpatched or degraded systems.

controls.title: Audit and Log Records
controls.description: Audit and log records are determined, documented, implemented, and reviewed in accordance with policy. Comprehensive logging supports detection, forensics, and compliance.

controls.title: Network Operations Baseline
controls.description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed. Baselines enable detection of anomalous activity.

controls.title: Event Data Aggregation and Correlation
controls.description: Event data are collected and correlated from multiple sources and sensors. Correlation of events across sources improves detection accuracy and reduces false positives.

controls.title: Network Monitoring
controls.description: The network is monitored to detect potential cybersecurity events. Continuous network monitoring enables rapid detection of intrusions and anomalies.

controls.title: Malicious Code Detection
controls.description: Malicious code is detected and remediated. Anti-malware controls protect against viruses, ransomware, and other malicious software.

controls.title: Unauthorized Activity Monitoring
controls.description: Monitoring for unauthorized personnel, connections, devices, and software is performed. Detecting unauthorized activity helps prevent breaches and policy violations.

controls.title: Detection Roles and Responsibilities
controls.description: Roles and responsibilities for detection are well-defined to ensure accountability. Clear ownership ensures detection processes are consistently performed.

controls.title: Incident Response Plan Execution
controls.description: Response plan is executed during or after an incident. A well-rehearsed response plan ensures rapid and effective containment of security incidents.

controls.title: Incident Notification Procedures
controls.description: Personnel know their roles and order of operations when a response is needed. Defined communication channels ensure timely notification of stakeholders during incidents.

controls.title: Incident Investigation and Analysis
controls.description: Notifications from detection systems are investigated to understand the scope, impact, and root cause. Thorough analysis supports effective containment and remediation.

controls.title: Incident Containment
controls.description: Incidents are contained to limit their impact and prevent further damage. Rapid containment minimizes the blast radius of security incidents.

controls.title: Recovery Plan Execution
controls.description: Recovery plan is executed during or after a cybersecurity incident. Structured recovery ensures that normal operations are restored in a timely and orderly fashion.

controls.title: Recovery Lessons Learned
controls.description: Recovery plans incorporate lessons learned from previous incidents and exercises. Continuous improvement of recovery processes strengthens organizational resilience.

controls.title: Recovery Communications
controls.description: Restoration activities are coordinated with internal and external parties, including coordinating centers and service providers. Clear communication during recovery minimizes confusion and accelerates restoration.
